title: The Placebo Revealed

Groundbreaking new studies indicate that even when study participants know they are taking a placebo, the effect works in conditions such as pain, depression, anxiety, and more. Given the dramatic results and potential for incorporation within the mainstream medical model, the implications of these findings are significant and a true testament to the power of the mind in healing the body.

title: North America’s Ice Age History
body: How did the first ancient migrants come to North America? Scientific theory now suggests that the crossing in the Ice Age may have been very different from previous interpretations. Did the first humans cross to the American content on islands, rather than a land bridge? These settlements may have been many thousands of years earlier than we once thought, raising questions about how we now see the timeline of human history.
teaser: Scientific theory now suggests that migratory crossing in the Ice Age may have been very different from previous interpretations.

title: Fasting for Brain Health
body: A new study suggests that intermittent fasting may promote long-term memory and prevent cognitive decline.  The main finding is that this popular fasting method turns on a gene that increases production of new neurons in the brain responsible for memory formation.  Researchers hope that this process has potential to slow the advance of cognitive decline in older people.
teaser: A new study suggests that intermittent fasting may promote long-term memory and prevent cognitive decline.  The main finding is that this fasting method turns on a gene that increases production of new neurons in the brain responsible for memory formation.

title: Heal & Transform with Breath

An influx of new research and an explosion of interest in breathwork are showing a myriad of physiological and psychological benefits of various practices.  While there are many different techniques that can be tailored to different purposes, they all consist of augmenting the inhale, exhale, and retention.  All are designed to activate this powerful medicine within each of us.
teaser: Most of us take breath for granted. Yet, when we learn to harness it, it can be key not only to our physical wellbeing, but to our spiritual transformation.

title: Viking Crystal Navigation
body: In ancient times, Vikings were the most famous sea explorers. How did the Vikings navigate through Arctic latitudes when they could not see the sun? Kaedrich Olsen describes the sunstone, a mysterious crystal tool that science now shows to be highly effective in locating the light of the sun hidden behind clouds.

New studies in the emerging field of Circadian Medicine show that as we align ourselves with nature we can shift these rhythms to counteract the imbalances caused by our modern lifestyles and exposure to blue light. The ancient science of Ayurveda also demonstrates that living in rhythm with natural daily and seasonal cycles leads to a more balanced life. title: Microbiome Extinction

A new study shows that we have lost many of the organisms that we co-existed with a millennium ago. How can we restore this diversity? Doctors and others are examining the evidence of how a healthier, more diverse gut may help us avoid chronic conditions such as diabetes and obesity. Science is learning more about pre-industrialized humans in the hope that it may be possible to restore some of the lost microbiome, and improve our balance in the modern world.

What could we learn in the future from the release of this information? Journalist Cheryl Costa discusses the implications of the information being brought to light.

title: Dr. Bruce Lipton Reacts to New Map of Human Genome Part 1
body:
Scientists announce the completion of the sequencing of the human genome map, which is often called the genetic instruction book. Cellular biologist Dr. Bruce Lipton shares his reaction and discusses the key role played by epigenetics, or the control of genes by environment and thoughts. He presents evidence that we have the ability to master our genes, as opposed to being victims of them.

Don’t miss Part 2 of this Gaia News special investigation on the science of epigenetics.

May 24, 2022
teaser: Scientists announce the completion of the sequencing of the human genome map. Cellular biologist Dr. Bruce Lipton shares his reaction and discusses the key role played by epigenetics to control of genes by environment and thoughts.

title: Dr. Bruce Lipton Reacts to New Map of Human Genome Part 2
body:
Can we rewrite the expression of our genetic blueprint? Cellular biologist Dr. Bruce Lipton is a pioneer in the field of epigenetics, which holds that genetic expression can be affected by environment and thoughts.. Dr. Lipton suggests that we can gain mastery over our genes by practicing various modalities which can help rewrite the deep-seated programs in our subconscious minds to uncover our true potential for health and wellbeing.

May 26, 2022
teaser: Can we rewrite the expression of our genetic blueprint? The emerging science of epigenetics provides an alternate view of how we can gain mastery over our genes and achieve true wellbeing.

title: World's Largest Geoglyphs Discovered in India
body:
Mysterious geoglyphs continue to be found across the planet. Who made these enigmatic, sprawling designs, and why? The world's largest geoglyphs have now been found in a desert in India, the first on the subcontinent.  Independent researchers Carlo and Yohann Oetheimer discuss their discovery of the massive desert patterns and what we may learn about their origins and symbolism.

May 31, 2022
teaser: Mysterious geoglyphs continue to be found across the planet. Who made these massive designs, and why? Researchers discuss the implications of the world's largest geoglyphs that have now been found in a desert in India.

title: Mindfulness Training Drastically Helps Kids Sleep
body:
Given the alarmingly accelerating rates of sleep difficulties in children, the need for safe solutions is pressing. Dr. Christina Chick of Stanford University Medical School reviews the results of a recent study, which showed that a mindfulness training program implemented within the school day made a dramatic impact on children's sleep. Dr. Chick discusses the implications of the findings and suggests ways in which parents can utilize some of the strategies to help improve their kids' sleep, and their overall health and wellbeing.

June 7, 2022
teaser: Research shows that training children in mindfulness techniques can dramatically improve their sleep. Dr. Christina Chick of Stanford University Medical School reviews the results of a recent study.

title: Woman Missing Part of Brain Astounds Scientists
body:
Just how adaptable are our brains? A recent study sheds light on the experience of a woman who- to the utter surprise of doctors- despite having lived most of her life missing a key part of her brain, has barely been affected by it.  Her case is both a testament to the human brain's seemingly limitless flexibility and to the ever-evolving understanding of the idea of what its "normal" is.
